column4: Hi. How do I get rid of gnome-utils, without removing ubuntu-desktop ?
out of curiosity....why do you want to remove them?
I'm remastering Ubuntu. I'm creating an ISO with a minimum of software, and I don't want e.g. gnome-dictionary to show up in the application menu
I am wondering if you can control what shows up in the menu ahead of time  by editing it with alacarte
although I havent tried ,,, it seems that by editing alacarte and which menu items will be in there should transfer over to the iso
Perhaps, but removing the software I don't want is prefered :)
not sure then  ... You may want to scoot over the #gnome on the server or the official one on  gimpnet  #gnome
are you using remastersys?
I don't believe this is a problem related to Gnome. After all, gnome-utils depends on ubuntu-desktop which has nothing to do with Gnome :)
Nope, doing it by hand
Extracting ISO, chrooting, etc
mmm.... then I am at aloss to help then,, I have not done this is for quite a while
Okay, thanks anyways, I appreciate it :)
that seems reasonable to assume ..yes
ignore what I just said,, Dr_Willis  is most likely correct about this since I nearly never use  ati
the real issue would be  intel / nvidia
Why ?
intel / nvidia drivers on the same system  have produced some very strange  outcomes....one is desktop is completely upside down and reversed
at least that situation the system worked  if you stood on your head :)
Crazy :)
and in that situation the best solution would be to remove the nvidia driver
